title: Why did I receive a punishment?
body:
I have been playing this game for many years and have NEVER received any type of punishment or warning; however, I just logged in after several days to a warning that I was reported for unsportsmanlike and have received a penalty. I really wish to know what I did. I generally refrain from saying much in chat and the only thing I have said recently was my last game in which I was being told how trash I was and such by our JG and all I did was ask the other team to please report him for toxic and verbal abuse. 

I have spent A LOT of money in this game and really want to know what caused this penalty as I do not feel I have done anything to warrant such.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Cynphony,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=XOIUBEP3,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-04-15T04:11:08.600+0000)
>
I was reported for unsportsmanlike and have received a penalty.

Chat logs pls
Where do I find my Chat Logs? I was literally given nothing, it just said that I was reported for unsportsmanlike and a penalty has been issued when I logged in. Other than that I have seen nothing.

To speak to a rioter, you can submit a support [ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). 

You are usually given chat logs for punishments, which can be found in the report card when you log in. 

Asking for reports is harassing, but that alone is not enough to get you punished.
If you provide the chat logs that should be provided to you in your email we can see what could have gotten you punished.

> [{quoted}](name=Cynphony,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=XOIUBEP3,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-04-15T04:11:08.600+0000)
>
> all I did was ask the other team to please report him for toxic and verbal abuse. 

That's probably what it was, if someone reported you for it. Report Calling is unsportsmanlike behavior and completely useless since it only takes one report to flag a match for review by the IFS. It doesn't matter if someone gets 1 or 9 reports on them in a match, the IFS will look at it either way.
